thread.section_title: Woman ‘fed live puppies and kittens to python then put pictures online’ – Metro
thread.title: Woman ‘fed live puppies and kittens to python then put pictures online’
thread.title_full: Woman ‘fed live puppies and kittens to python then put pictures online’

author: Richard Hartley-Parkinson
title: Woman ‘fed live puppies and kittens to python then put pictures online’
text:
(Picture: Guardia Civil) A woman is being investigated after it was alleged that she fed live puppies and kittens to her pet python.
The unnamed woman is then said to have posted pictures of the snake crushing at least one of them to death.
An image of one of the pets being killed that was spotted on an advert for a pet snake by a worker at an animal shelter has been released by the Guardia Civil.
Five frozen tigers with their organs removed discovered in man's freezer The animal shelter worker posed as a potential buyer to approach the woman who said she gave the snake live dogs, cats and birds.
She could face charges of animal abuse following the allegations in the town of Loja, Grenada, according to The Local.
Royal Pythons, like the one pictured, kill their pray by crushing them to death or starving them of oxygen.
They are non-venemous, can live for up to 30 years and grow to about 5ft, making them one of the most popular pet snake breeds in the world
